Instruction: In the file B45QJ2Z.pdf, on page 5, within the second rectangle, perform the following operations: move the vector graphics 15 units upward and scale them down by a factor of 0.8. Apply these operations to the rebar class using the Cover mode selection method.
Groundtruth:
import fitz
import PDFbf

# Open the file
filepath = "B45QJ2Z.pdf"
doc = fitz.open(filepath)

# Initialize annotation extractor
annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)

# Extract the rectangle and reference point for page 5, second rectangle
pagenumber = 4  # Page 5 corresponds to pagenumber=4 (zero-indexed)
rectangleorder = 1  # Second rectangle corresponds to rectangleorder=1
rectangle, rfpoint = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber, rectangleorder=rectangleorder)

# Prepare arguments for operations
argument = dict(
    clip=rectangle,
    move=[0, 15, rfpoint],  # Moving 15 units upward
    scal=['sc', [0.8, 0.8], rfpoint]  # Scaling down by a factor of 0.8
)

# Initialize vector selector
selector = PDFbf.selector(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber, clip=argument.get("clip"))

# Select rebars using Cover mode
covered_rebars = selector.mode1_rebars_Window_Cover_Enclosure()

# Initialize vector projector and apply operations
projector = PDFbf.project_draw(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber,
    clip=argument.get("clip"),
    sel_drawings=covered_rebars,
    cdrawings=selector.selected_lines,
    move=argument.get("move"),
    scal=argument.get("scal")
)
doc = projector.project()

# Save the updated file
updated_filepath = filepath[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc.save(updated_filepath)

import fitz
import PDFbf

# Open the file
filepath = "R82KP9Y.pdf"
doc = fitz.open(filepath)

# Initialize annotation extractor
annoextractor = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)

# Extract the rectangle and reference point for page 8, fourth rectangle
pagenumber = 7  # Page 8 corresponds to pagenumber=7 (zero-indexed)
rectangleorder = 3  # Fourth rectangle corresponds to rectangleorder=3
rectangle, rfpoint = annoextractor.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber, rectangleorder=rectangleorder)

# Prepare arguments for operations
argument = dict(
    clip=rectangle,
    move=[-10, 0, rfpoint],  # Moving 10 units to the left
    rotation=['r', 45, rfpoint]  # Rotating 45 degrees clockwise
)

# Initialize vector selector
selector = PDFbf.selector(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber, clip=argument.get("clip"))

# Select columns and lines using Intersect mode
intersected_columns = selector.mode2_columns_Cross_Touch_Intersect()
intersected_lines = selector.mode2_lines_Cross_Touch_Intersect()

projector_columns = PDFbf.project_draw(

    pagenumber=pagenumber,
    clip=argument.get("clip"),
    sel_drawings=intersected_columns + intersected_lines,
    cdrawings=selector.selected_lines,
    move=argument.get("move"),
    rotation=argument.get("rotation")
)
doc = projector_columns.project()


# Save the updated file

    clip=rectangle,
    move=[0, 10, rfpoint],  # Moving 10 units upward
    rotation=['r', 45, rfpoint]  # Rotating 45 degrees clockwise
)

    move=[15, 0, rfpoint],  # Moving 15 units to the right

    pagenumber=pagenumber,
    clip=argument1.get("clip"),
    sel_drawings=covered_lines,
    cdrawings=selector.selected_lines,
    move=argument1.get("move"),
    rotation=argument1.get("rotation")
)

    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber,
    clip=argument2.get("clip"),
    sel_drawings=intersected_columns,

    scal=argument2.get("scal")
)

)

doc = fitz.open(filepath)


annoextractor1 = PDFbf.extractanno(doc=doc)


pagenumber5 = 6 
rectangleorder5 = 1 
rectangle5, rfpoint5 = annoextractor1.getclip_rfpoint(pagenumber=pagenumber5, rectangleorder=rectangleorder5)

argument_group5 = dict(
    clip=rectangle5,
    move=[0, 5, rfpoint5]  
)

# Initialize vector selector for Group 1
selector5= PDFbf.selector(doc=doc, pagenumber=pagenumber5, clip=argument_group5.get("clip"))
intersected_lines = selector5.mode1_lines_Window_Cover_Enclosure()

# Apply operation to line class
projector5_lines = PDFbf.project_draw(
    doc=doc,
    pagenumber=pagenumber5,
    clip=argument_group5.get("clip"),
    sel_drawings=intersected_lines,
    cdrawings=selector5.selected_lines,
    move=argument_group5.get("move")
)
doc = projector5_lines.project()

# Save the updated file
updated_filepath = filepath[:-4] + "_updated.pdf"
doc.save(updated_filepath)
